title: Choosing the Right AI Model for Personal Use on Local Devices
content:
Chá»n MÃ´ HÃ¬nh AI PhÃ¹ Há»£p cho Sá»­ Dá»¥ng CÃ¡ NhÃ¢n trÃªn Thiáº¿t Bá»‹ Cá»¥c Bá»™SummaryViá»‡c lá»±a chá»n mÃ´ hÃ¬nh AI phÃ¹ há»£p Ä‘á»ƒ sá»­ dá»¥ng trÃªn pháº§n cá»©ng cÃ¡ nhÃ¢n Ä‘Ã²i há»i sá»± cÃ¢n nháº¯c ká»¹ lÆ°á»¡ng vá» cÃ¡c yáº¿u tá»‘ nhÆ° tÃ i nguyÃªn tÃ­nh toÃ¡n, yÃªu cáº§u hiá»‡u suáº¥t vÃ  trÆ°á»ng há»£p sá»­ dá»¥ng cá»¥ thá»ƒ. BÃ i viáº¿t nÃ y sáº½ Ä‘á» cáº­p Ä‘áº¿n nhá»¯ng yáº¿u tá»‘ quan trá»ng khi triá»ƒn khai mÃ´ hÃ¬nh AI trÃªn pháº§n cá»©ng ngÆ°á»i dÃ¹ng phá»• thÃ´ng.
Hiá»ƒu vá» Äá»‹nh Dáº¡ng GGUFGGUF (GPT-Generated Unified Format) mang láº¡i nhiá»u lá»£i Ã­ch khi triá»ƒn khai cá»¥c bá»™:
Thá»i gian táº£i nhanh hÆ¡n so vá»›i cÃ¡c Ä‘á»‹nh dáº¡ng khÃ¡c Tá»‘i Æ°u hÃ³a Ä‘áº·c biá»‡t cho cáº¥u hÃ¬nh pháº§n cá»©ng ngÆ°á»i dÃ¹ng phá»• thÃ´ng TÆ°Æ¡ng thÃ­ch vá»›i cÃ¡c framework phá»• biáº¿n nhÆ° Unsloth, mang láº¡i hiá»‡u suáº¥t á»•n Ä‘á»‹nh áº¢nh HÆ°á»Ÿng cá»§a QuantizationQuantization Ä‘Ã³ng vai trÃ² quan trá»ng trong viá»‡c cÃ¢n báº±ng giá»¯a hiá»‡u suáº¥t mÃ´ hÃ¬nh vÃ  má»©c tiÃªu thá»¥ tÃ i nguyÃªn:
Má»©c quantization tháº¥p hÆ¡n (vÃ­ dá»¥: Q4) giÃºp giáº£m yÃªu cáº§u RAM nhÆ°ng cÃ³ thá»ƒ áº£nh hÆ°á»Ÿng Ä‘áº¿n Ä‘á»™ chÃ­nh xÃ¡c Quantization Q4 thÆ°á»ng mang láº¡i sá»± cÃ¢n báº±ng tá»‘i Æ°u giá»¯a kÃ­ch thÆ°á»›c mÃ´ hÃ¬nh vÃ  Ä‘á»™ chÃ­nh xÃ¡c Khi chá»n má»©c quantization, cáº§n xem xÃ©t thÃ´ng sá»‘ pháº§n cá»©ng vÃ  yÃªu cáº§u hiá»‡u suáº¥t cá»§a báº¡n Äá»ƒ xÃ¡c Ä‘á»‹nh má»©c quantization phÃ¹ há»£p vá»›i pháº§n cá»©ng cá»§a mÃ¬nh, báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ tham kháº£o cÃ´ng cá»¥ Can I Run This LLM. CÃ´ng cá»¥ nÃ y há»— trá»£ tÃ­nh toÃ¡n má»©c quantization tá»‘i Ä‘a cÃ³ thá»ƒ sá»­ dá»¥ng trÃªn GPU cá»§a Nvidia, AMD vÃ  Apple.
CÃ¢n Nháº¯c vá» KÃ­ch ThÆ°á»›c MÃ´ HÃ¬nhMá»‘i quan há»‡ giá»¯a kÃ­ch thÆ°á»›c mÃ´ hÃ¬nh vÃ  hiá»‡u suáº¥t khÃ´ng Ä‘Æ¡n giáº£n:
CÃ¡c phiÃªn báº£n quantized tháº¥p cá»§a mÃ´ hÃ¬nh lá»›n thÆ°á»ng hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng tá»‘t hÆ¡n cÃ¡c phiÃªn báº£n quantized cao cá»§a mÃ´ hÃ¬nh nhá» hÆ¡n Äá»‘i vá»›i cÃ¡c tÃ¡c vá»¥ viáº¿t, cÃ¡c mÃ´ hÃ¬nh reasoning lá»›n (bao gá»“m cáº£ cÃ¡c phiÃªn báº£n distilled) cho káº¿t quáº£ tá»‘t hÆ¡n vá»›i Ã­t lá»—i nhiá»…u (hallucination) Vá»›i cÃ¡c tÃ¡c vá»¥ láº­p luáº­n vÃ  giáº£i quyáº¿t váº¥n Ä‘á» logic, sá»± khÃ¡c biá»‡t giá»¯a cÃ¡c kÃ­ch thÆ°á»›c mÃ´ hÃ¬nh Ã­t quan trá»ng hÆ¡n Tá»‘i Æ¯u HÃ³a PhÃ¢n Bá»• TÃ i NguyÃªn Pháº§n Cá»©ngViá»‡c phÃ¢n bá»• tÃ i nguyÃªn há»£p lÃ½ cÃ³ áº£nh hÆ°á»Ÿng lá»›n Ä‘áº¿n hiá»‡u suáº¥t:
Chá»n cÃ¡c mÃ´ hÃ¬nh cÃ³ thá»ƒ cháº¡y mÃ  khÃ´ng lÃ m CPU chá»‹u táº£i quÃ¡ lá»›n so vá»›i GPU CÃ¡c mÃ´ hÃ¬nh cÃ³ thá»ƒ cháº¡y hoÃ n toÃ n trong VRAM thÆ°á»ng mang láº¡i hiá»‡u suáº¥t tá»‘t hÆ¡n PhÃ¢n bá»• tÃ i nguyÃªn há»£p lÃ½ giÃºp duy trÃ¬ tá»‘c Ä‘á»™ táº¡o token há»£p lÃ½ (tokens per second) MÃ´ hÃ¬nh khÃ´ng phÃ¹ há»£p cÃ³ thá»ƒ khiáº¿n thá»i gian pháº£n há»“i quÃ¡ lÃ¢u (5-10 phÃºt) Fine-tuning cho á»¨ng Dá»¥ng ChuyÃªn Biá»‡tÄá»ƒ cÃ³ hiá»‡u suáº¥t tá»‘i Æ°u trong cÃ¡c lÄ©nh vá»±c cá»¥ thá»ƒ:
CÃ¢n nháº¯c sá»­ dá»¥ng cÃ¡c mÃ´ hÃ¬nh Ä‘Ã£ fine-tuned cho cÃ¡c á»©ng dá»¥ng chuyÃªn biá»‡t Fine-tuning theo tá»«ng lÄ©nh vá»±c cÃ³ thá»ƒ cáº£i thiá»‡n Ä‘Ã¡ng ká»ƒ Ä‘á»™ chÃ­nh xÃ¡c vÃ  hiá»‡u suáº¥t ÄÃ¡nh giÃ¡ xem hiá»‡u suáº¥t tÄƒng cÃ³ xá»©ng Ä‘Ã¡ng vá»›i tÃ i nguyÃªn cáº§n thiáº¿t Ä‘á»ƒ fine-tune hay khÃ´ng Káº¿t Luáº­nViá»‡c chá»n mÃ´ hÃ¬nh AI phÃ¹ há»£p Ä‘á»ƒ triá»ƒn khai cá»¥c bá»™ cáº§n cÃ¢n nháº¯c nhiá»u yáº¿u tá»‘ nhÆ° Ä‘á»‹nh dáº¡ng, má»©c quantization, kÃ­ch thÆ°á»›c mÃ´ hÃ¬nh vÃ  cÃ¡ch phÃ¢n bá»• tÃ i nguyÃªn pháº§n cá»©ng. Báº±ng cÃ¡ch xem xÃ©t ká»¹ lÆ°á»¡ng cÃ¡c yáº¿u tá»‘ nÃ y vÃ  sá»­ dá»¥ng cÃ¡c cÃ´ng cá»¥ nhÆ° Can I Run This LLM, ngÆ°á»i dÃ¹ng cÃ³ thá»ƒ tá»‘i Æ°u hÃ³a hiá»‡u suáº¥t mÃ´ hÃ¬nh mÃ  váº«n Ä‘áº£m báº£o hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng trong giá»›i háº¡n pháº§n cá»©ng sáºµn cÃ³.

title: Finding Your Niche in the MMO Business
content: 2025 26 02 Finding Your Niche in the MMO Business

title: Git
content:
Gittestwhat should i do with this?
I’ll explain Git workflow in simple terms, like you’re five! ğŸŒŸ
1. Your Local Repository (Like Your Toy Box) ğŸ“¦Think of your local repository (C:\Users\nneko\muondingu) as your toy box. It has three main areas:
Working Directory: Where you play with your toys (make changes to files) Staging Area: Where you put toys you want to keep (staged changes) Local Repository: Your toy box where you store toys properly (committed changes) 2. Remote Repository (Like a Shared Toy Box at School) ğŸ«GitHub is like a shared toy box at school You can put your toys there (push) Get new toys from there (pull) Share toys with friends (collaborate) Basic Workflow Commands ğŸ®Check what toys are out (changed files): git status Put toys in the staging area (stage changes): git add filename # Stage specific file git add . # Stage all changes Store toys in your toy box (commit): git commit -m "I added new toys" Share toys with school (push to GitHub): git push origin master Get new toys from school (pull from GitHub): git pull origin master Let’s practice this workflow with your repository:
git status Let’s check what’s in your themes folder since we saw changes there earlier:
ls themes Now, let me explain how to manage your repository step by step:
Daily Workflow ğŸ“…Before Starting Work git pull origin master # Get latest changes from GitHub While Working git status # Check what you changed git add . # Stage your changes git commit -m "Message" # Save your changes with a note When Finished git push origin master # Share your changes on GitHub Special Cases ğŸ¯If you want to undo changes before staging: git restore filename # Undo changes in a file If you want to undo staged changes: git restore --staged filename # Unstage changes If you want to see your change history: git log # See all your saves (commits) For Your Current Situation ğŸ¯You have theme folders that have been modified. You have two options:
Track theme changes directly: git add themes/ git commit -m "Update theme customizations" git push origin master Use themes as submodules (more advanced): This is like having a toy box inside your main toy box. It’s more complex but better for theme management. Which approach would you prefer? The simple direct tracking or the more advanced submodule approach? I can guide you through either one! ğŸ˜Š
branchesAh, perfect! Let me explain Git branches using the game save analogy! ğŸ®
Branches = Game Save Files! ğŸ®Think of Git like your favorite video game with multiple save slots:
main/master: Your main story save file feature branches: Alternate save files where you try different quests stash: Quick save before trying something risky Basic Save Commands ğŸ®Check Your Save Files git branch # Shows all your local save files git branch -a # Shows ALL save files (including online backups) Create New Save File git checkout -b new-quest # Like choosing an empty save slot Switch Between Saves git checkout quest-name # Like loading a different save file Save File Management ğŸ¯Making a New Save (Creating a branch) git checkout -b side-quest-1 # "New Game+" from your main save Saving Your Progress (Committing) git add . # Mark what to save git commit -m "Beat the boss!" # Save with a note Uploading Save Files (Pushing) git push origin side-quest-1 # Upload your save to the cloud Common Save Scenarios ğŸŒŸStarting a New Quest git checkout main # Load main save git checkout -b new-feature # Create new save slot # Try new stuff without fear! Merging Quest Rewards (Merging branches) git checkout main # Go back to main save git merge new-feature # Add cool stuff from side quest Emergency Save (Stashing) git stash # Quick save current progress git stash pop # Load quick save Save File Types ğŸ“Main Story Save (main/master) Your stable, working game Where everything is tested and works The save file you’d show your friends Side Quest Saves (feature branches) Try new weapons/skills Test different strategies If they work, add them to main save Quick Fix Saves (hotfix branches) When something breaks in main save Quick repairs without starting over Merge back to main immediately Pro Gamer Tips ğŸ†Always Save Before Big Fights git checkout -b risky-feature # New save before trying something crazy Keep Save Files Organized feature/new-weapon # New weapon testing bugfix/broken-shield # Fixing broken equipment test/boss-strategy # Trying new boss strategies Cloud Saves (Remote repositories) git push origin your-save # Upload to cloud git pull origin your-save # Download from cloud Save File Safety ğŸ›¡ï¸Protect Your Main Save Never experiment directly on main Always make a new save file for tests Review changes before merging Regular Backups git checkout your-save git pull origin main # Update with latest main save Clean Up Old Saves git branch -d old-save # Delete completed quest saves Remember: Branches are like free save slots in your favorite game! They let you:
Try crazy strategies Test new features Keep your main save safe Team up with other players Want to learn more about any of these game save techniques? ğŸ®

Pseudonyms: Sá»­ dá»¥ng má»™t tÃªn giáº£, Ä‘áº£m báº£o khÃ´ng liÃªn káº¿t vá»›i danh tÃ­nh thá»±c cá»§a báº¡n. Anonymous Emails: ÄÄƒng kÃ½ vá»›i cÃ¡c dá»‹ch vá»¥ nhÆ° ProtonMail hoáº·c Tutanota, trÃ¡nh cung cáº¥p thÃ´ng tin cÃ¡ nhÃ¢n. VPNs: Che giáº¥u Ä‘á»‹a chá»‰ IP cá»§a báº¡n vá»›i cÃ¡c nhÃ  cung cáº¥p nhÆ° ExpressVPN hoáº·c NordVPN, chá»n chÃ­nh sÃ¡ch no-log policies. Tor Browser: Sá»­ dá»¥ng Ä‘á»ƒ Ä‘áº£m báº£o áº©n danh máº¡nh máº½, máº·c dÃ¹ tá»‘c Ä‘á»™ cÃ³ thá»ƒ cháº­m hÆ¡n; táº£i xuá»‘ng tá»« Tor Project. Loáº¡i bá» Metadata: Loáº¡i bá» dá»¯ liá»‡u tá»« cÃ¡c tá»‡p báº±ng cÃ¡c cÃ´ng cá»¥ nhÆ° ExifTool Ä‘á»ƒ trÃ¡nh tiáº¿t lá»™ vá»‹ trÃ­ hoáº·c thÃ´ng tin thiáº¿t bá»‹. Lá»±a chá»n ná»n táº£ngChá»n ná»n táº£ng má»™t cÃ¡ch khÃ´n ngoan Ä‘á»ƒ Ä‘áº£m báº£o áº©n danh:
Medium: Sá»­ dá»¥ng pseudonym vÃ  anonymous email, nhÆ°ng hÃ£y cáº©n tháº­n vá»›i viá»‡c thu tháº­p dá»¯ liá»‡u. WordPress: Self-hosted WordPress cung cáº¥p nhiá»u quyá»n kiá»ƒm soÃ¡t hÆ¡n; sá»­ dá»¥ng Ä‘Äƒng kÃ½ tÃªn miá»n báº£o vá»‡ quyá»n riÃªng tÆ°. WordPress.com thu tháº­p dá»¯ liá»‡u, vÃ¬ váº­y hÃ£y háº¡n cháº¿ thÃ´ng tin cÃ¡ nhÃ¢n. Social Media: CÃ³ rá»§i ro cao hÆ¡n do yÃªu cáº§u tÃªn tháº­t; sá»­ dá»¥ng pseudonyms vÃ  giáº£m thiá»ƒu thÃ´ng tin cÃ¡ nhÃ¢n, nhÆ°ng hÃ£y chuáº©n bá»‹ cho viá»‡c theo dÃµi dá»¯ liá»‡u. Chiáº¿n lÆ°á»£c ná»™i dung vÃ  báº£o máº­tChiáº¿n lÆ°á»£c ná»™i dung:
Viáº¿t má»™t cÃ¡ch trung láº­p, trÃ¡nh cÃ¡c cÃ¢u chuyá»‡n cÃ¡ nhÃ¢n; táº¡o má»™t persona thÆ°Æ¡ng hiá»‡u nháº¥t quÃ¡n. KhÃ´ng bao giá» chia sáº» thÃ´ng tin nháº­n dáº¡ng nhÆ° vá»‹ trÃ­ hoáº·c nÆ¡i lÃ m viá»‡c; Ä‘Ã¡nh giÃ¡ rá»§i ro, Ä‘áº·c biá»‡t lÃ  cho cÃ¡c chá»§ Ä‘á» gÃ¢y tranh cÃ£i. Báº£o máº­t sá»± hiá»‡n diá»‡n trá»±c tuyáº¿n:
Sá»­ dá»¥ng máº­t kháº©u máº¡nh, duy nháº¥t vá»›i trÃ¬nh quáº£n lÃ½ máº­t kháº©u; kÃ­ch hoáº¡t 2FA (xÃ¡c thá»±c hai yáº¿u tá»‘). Duyá»‡t web á»Ÿ cháº¿ Ä‘á»™ private browsing, xÃ³a cookies thÆ°á»ng xuyÃªn, vÃ  trÃ¡nh liÃªn káº¿t cÃ¡c tÃ i khoáº£n áº©n danh vá»›i danh tÃ­nh thá»±c. TrÃ¡nh defamation (phá»‰ bÃ¡ng) vÃ  hate speech (phÃ¡t ngÃ´n thÃ¹ Ä‘á»‹ch); cÃ¡c tÃ²a Ã¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ yÃªu cáº§u thÃ´ng tin ngÆ°á»i dÃ¹ng tá»« cÃ¡c ná»n táº£ng.
